conclusion: Determine the speed of the block when it slides from point A to point B and the ratio of the supporting force to the gravitational force at point B.
The block is released from rest at point A, which is at the same horizontal level as the center O of the circular track.
The radius of the circular track is R = 0.8 m.
The height difference between point A and point B is the radius of the circular track, R = 0.8 m.
The potential energy at point A is U_A = mgh = mgR.
At point B, the block has converted all its potential energy into kinetic energy.
Using the conservation of energy, U_A = K_B.
Solving for v_B: v_B = sqrt(2gR).
At point B, the block is moving in a circular path with a centripetal force.
The centripetal force is provided by the normal force N minus the gravitational force mg.
The centripetal force is given by F_c = mv_B^2/R.
The normal force N at point B is N = mg + F_c.
N = mg + mv_B^2/R.
Substituting v_B and R: N = mg + m(4 m/s)^2/0.8 m.
N = mg + 20m.
The gravitational force is mg.
The ratio of the supporting force N to the gravitational force mg is N/mg = 30m/mg = 30/10 = 3.
